title: Survival Cantonese for International Students
description: A non-credit bearing basic Cantonese course designed for non-Chinese speakers, including exchange and international full-time undergraduate and postgraduate students, who use Chinese as a foreign/ second language and look for survival skills in Cantonese. The course is structured to help students communicate orally with the local people in Cantonese in different scenarios, with student-centred, proficiency-orientated activities based on useful daily expressions and basic vocabulary items. It focuses on student's oral skills and speaking ability. Real life settings are introduced such as shopping, introduction of oneself, asking directions, etc.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs.(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。（S&L2）將所學句式和詞彙適當地運用於日常生活之中
syllabus: Learning topics include:-Introduction to Cantonese sounds and tones and basic Cantonese particles. Common loan words in Cantonese-Basic greeting expressions and classroom expressions-Common dishes in Hong Kong-Simple useful expressions for telephone conversation, taxis and minibuses-Places of interests in Hong Kong-Sports and pastime-Clothes and basic necessity-Names of major buildings in CUHK and campus facilities (dormitories, supermarket, clinic and canteen, etc.)內容包括：-粵語語音及拼寫法、常見外來語-問候、課室用語-常見香港菜餚-電話對話、乘搭的士及小巴的通用語-香港名勝-運動及娛樂-衣履及日常用品-中大主要大樓名稱及校園設施（宿舍、超市、保健處、飯堂等等）
required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

title: Introduction to Chinese Scripts
description: An elementary course to introduce basic Chinese characters with real life examples. Introduction will also be given to the formation of Chinese characters, stroke order, and the interesting stories behind.

title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar I
description: An elementary course designed to familiarize students with the use of Romanization, basic vocabulary and grammar points. Vocabulary introduced based on everyday conversations and daily usage. Focus will be on appropriateness in application.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中較簡短的對話
syllabus: This course introduces Cantonese sounds and tones as well as vocabulary items and sentence patterns in relation to the topics below: 1. Greetings 2. At school 3. What time is it? 4. What is today’s date? 5. A shopping day

title: Oral Skills Practice I
description: An elementary course focused on students' fluency in communication with basic vocabulary and grammar points through various kinds of speaking practice. Real life settings are introduced such as shopping, introducing family members, asking directions etc.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO1: for levels 1-2) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning and satisfy a very limited number of immediate needs. (S&L 2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage  學生於完成本科時預期能： （學習成果：第一級和第二級）有限度地使用粵語作簡短問答以應付日常生活中的即時之需。 (S&L2) 將所學句式和詞匯適當地運用於日常生活之中

description: This is a foundation course on Cantonese which introduces the “Yale Romanization Scheme” of Cantonese. Course contents include basic daily conversation, vowels and tone exercises and pronunciation practice. It enables learners to understand the “Yale Romanization Scheme” and engage in real life conversation by using simple Cantonese.

requirements: 1.For students who have taken CLCC1703,CCAN1703,2013;2.Not for students taken CLCC3703,CCAN3703 or CCAN3013;3.For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC
description: An intermediate course for students who have completed CLCC1703, CCAN1703 or CCAN2013. For students who have not completed any of the above courses, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLC. Course contents focus on social topics. Trainings in different contexts can increase students' vocabulary. It also improves their pronunciation and exchange of ideas in different social activities. Furthermore, it assists them to complete a number of tasks in school or working environments.Advisory: For Putonghua speaking non-local students who are not beginners.

title: Cantonese for Real Life Communication (Formal Setting)
requirements: 1.For student who have taken CLCC1100,1703,2703orCCAN1703,2703,2013or3013;2.Not for student taken CLCC3703,CCAN3703or4013;3.For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1,they are invited to take placement test offered by CLC
description: A non-credit bearing Cantonese course designed for Putonghua speaking full-time undergraduate students, postgraduate students, tutors or research assistants from Mainland, Taiwan or other regions. The course is structured to help students in learning relevant expressions and to apply them in their tutorial lessons or at work. Training includes: (1) effective utilization of basic Cantonese in communicating with local students during tutorials and (2) proper use of academic Cantonese to make simple description and presentation of one’s thesis to their academic advisors or colleagues. Students will acquire relevant vocabularies under professional setting which in turn help them in adjusting to University and work life in Hong Kong. Ultimately, the learning atmosphere of tutorial class can be improved.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO3: for levels 5-6) participate actively in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of speaking tasks with communicative strategies, deal effectively with unanticipated complications in oral communication, can satisfy the requirements of school and work situations.(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures at the discourse level in real life professional conversations with appropriate usage學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第五級和第六級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中談話的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略， 能完成學習或工作中常見的任務。（S&L2）運用所學句式和詞彙，應付在正式和非正式場合中交際的需要
syllabus: Learning topics include: -Topics: Introduce one’s professional field, ask questions and obtain skills to express ideas, share difficulties and solutions about living in the University, relevant vocabularies at work, presenting to the public, lead mock tutorials and academic forums-Classroom teaching and exercises: Listening practice, language tasks, correction of pronunciation and grammar points and group discussion-Classroom learning includes the role of Computerized Oral Proficiency Assessment (COPA) as an assessment tool developed by CLC in 2000 from which appropriate level of semi-authentic life tasks will be selected for practice by students as part of the course. Students will be equipped to participate in different social and formal interactions內容包括：-話題: 介紹自己的專業、粵語的提問及表達技巧、分享在大學生活遇到的困難及解決方法、工作用語、公開場合演講、模擬導修課、模擬學術研討會- 練習及上課形式: 聆聽練習、完成語文任務、糾正發音及語法、小組討論- 課堂教學將在本所2000年開發並實施的電腦口語水平測試 (COPA) 題庫中，選取相應的虛擬仿真語境，訓練學生完成不同功能的會話任務，令學生具備應對不同場合、不同交際對象進行交際的能力
required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course focused on building up students’ listening ability in advanced context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.

title: Advanced Reading and Speaking
description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with authentic materials and contextualized exercises in professional settings. Readings will be based on materials such as prose, argumentative essays, descriptive essays, drama scripts, etc.

title: Discussion Topics on Hong Kong Issues
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to build up the students’ confidence in using a variety of vocabulary in formal settings through specific topics and contextualized exercises. Topics include various local news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Discussion Topics on China Issues
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to further improve students’ fluency in professional communication settings through language activities, role playing and discussion practice. Topics for discussion include various China news and issues related to the Chinese society, such as education system, economy and immigration.
outcome: Students are expected to: (PO3: for levels 5-6) participate actively in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of speaking tasks with communicative strategies, deal effectively with unanticipated complications in oral communication, can satisfy the requirements of school and work situations. (S&L 5) present ideas at the discourse level in real life professional settings  學生於完成本科時預期能： (學習成果：第五級和第六級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中談話的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並與不同交際對象進行談話， 能完成學習或工作中常見的任務。 (S&L 5) 將所學句式和辭彙運用於適當的專業語境之中
syllabus: This course provides vocabulary and oral practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below: 1. China geography 2. Chinese history 3. Chinese religion 4. Chinese New Year 5. Chinese characters

title: Communication in Context V – Cantonese
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: An advanced course designed to train students’ presentation and negotiation ability in professional settings. Topics for discussion include various local & international news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.

title: Listening Comprehension Skills in Professional Settings
description: An advanced course focused on building up students' listening ability in professional context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include various local and international news and issues related to our society, such as education system,economy and immigration.

title: Newspaper Reading
description: An advanced course designed to improve students' language ability through the reading and discussion of selections from newspapers in standard written Chinese. Topics include international relations, political news, crime, economic news, accidents, etc.

title: Special Topics II
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: Courses designed for different kinds of working professionals, such as businesspersons, bankers, financial consultants, education specialists, religious and social workers, etc. Sector specific trainings are designed to cater for advanced students’ needs. e.g. the Cantonese for religious workers course provides training on Bible reading, Sunday liturgy and Mass liturgy.

title: Pragmatic Internship in China (PRINCH, Advanced Level)
requirements: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
description: PRINCH is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practice what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, focusing on topics related to social, political and economic issue. Class format consists of three parts: 1) Pre-trip activities with teachers; 2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants; and 3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
